intro: Didissandra longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaf didissandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
